verbose_text: IL-6 acts as both a proinflammatory and anti-inflammatory cytokine : when secreted by T cells and macrophages, IL-6 stimulates the immune response and boosts inflammatory reactions, while muscle produced IL-6 exerts anti-inflammatory effects through its inhibitory effects on TNF-alpha and IL-1beta and activation of interleukin-1 receptor antagonist (IL-1ra) and IL-10 [XREF_BIBR].
